questions.question_text:
You are implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service.

The customer wants to use the system to capture changes in various system readings when a technician is onsite servicing an asset.

What should you recommend?

choices.B: Create asset categories and track the changes from each work order.
choices.A: Train the field technicians to take detailed notes on the asset on the work order.
choices.D: Use the Asset Category Log history to track the changes.
choices.C: Use the Asset Property Log history to track the changes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Question is about adding custom entity to mobile in general, not to the offline mode. We need to add it to the sitemap so it is visible in the app

comments.content:
but again, even if you don't add it to the site map, it would be visible. maybe the use case would need it in a certain process and adding to the site map makes no point.

you are right offline mode and accessibility is not the same and it does not tell that it needs to be "accessible" offline. maybe they thought that for fields service it should be always acessible offline, but that's a bit far-fetched. 
re-reading it today, it is even a more confusing question.

i go for B. Create a new role and assign it to the technicians.
the reason is a pure grammatical one. the question speaks in plural about entitIES and A, C and D only in singulare ONE (THE) entity. While B can fit with the plural tense (but it is the worst idea to create (a new) fields app and a new role just for the sake to make custom entities (only) available to field service staff. With my sincere regret for these field service technicians.
still in two minds "to configure the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app" creating a new role does not configure this app... even though there is the thing with the plural and singular...

i also had the faint feeling that access could mean different things. but in a technical context i clearly understand it as adding privileges to an (exsiting) role and ensure the new entity supports offline and mobile capabilities. usually i would not read it as making it available in some menue. still i guess it is the correct answer. bad question

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the answer

choices.C: Add the entity to the site map of the Field Service mobile model-driven app.
choices.D: In the mobile offline profile, add a custom data filter to the entity.
choices.A: Go to the mobile offline profile, and add the entity.
choices.B: Create a new role and assign it to the technicians.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app to provide field technicians with access to custom entities.

What should you do?

DRAG DROP
-

Your customer wants to enable their Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app for offline use.

You need to configure the mobile app for technicians, including custom entity offline usage.

What are the first four steps you should perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of steps to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

comments.content: i would make the entities available for offline. not sure if this step is meant with: 1) Edit sitemap entities in Field Service Mobile model-driven app (so they are available to mobile online)

my answer is 
Create a mobile offline profile, or update the existing Field Service mobile offline profile to determine what data will be available while offline.
Enable entities for mobile offline synchronization.
Enable the Field Service mobile model-driven app for offline use.
Add users to the correct mobile offline profile, and publish the offline profile.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/mobile/setup-mobile-offline#set-up-a-mobile-offline-profile not sure if it is forbidden to enable the entities in a first step and how the test handles cases where multiple sequences are not wrong.

discussion.content:
Provided answers don't make any sense. You can't add entities to offline profile when they are not enabled for offline sync... 

1) Edit sitemap entities in Field Service Mobile model-driven app (so they are available to mobile online)
2) Enable entities for mobile offline sync (so that we can add them to mobile offline profile)
3) Create a mobile offline profile or update the existing... (so we add entities to mobile offline profile)
4) Add users to the correct mobile profile, and publish (so specific users can see entities added previously to mobile offline profile)

Seems like given answer is correct

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/mobile/setup-mobile-offline#set-up-a-mobile-offline-profile
You can refer the correct sequence of steps here : https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/field-service/mobile-power-app-system-offline.
